chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (P : R -> R -> Prop) (x y : R), locally_2d P x y <-> locally (x, y) (fun z : prod_UniformSpace R_UniformSpace R_UniformSpace => P (fst z) (snd z))

Premises:
locally_2d = fun (P : R -> R -> Prop) (x y : R) => exists delta : posreal, forall u v : R, Rabs (u - x) < delta -> Rabs (v - y) < delta -> P u v : (R -> R -> Prop) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]
R_UniformSpace = UniformSpace.Pack R R_UniformSpace_mixin R : UniformSpace
*** [ R : Set ]
prod_UniformSpace = fun U V : UniformSpace => UniformSpace.Pack (U * V) (prod_UniformSpace_mixin U V) (U * V) : UniformSpace -> UniformSpace -> UniformSpace
locally = fun (T : UniformSpace) (x : T) (P : T -> Prop) => exists eps : posreal, forall y : T, ball x eps y -> P y : forall T : UniformSpace, T -> (T -> Prop) -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope]
snd = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (_, y) := p in y : forall A B : Type, A * B -> B Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
fst = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (x, _) := p in x : forall A B : Type, A * B -> A Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
locally_interval : forall (P : R -> Prop) (x : R) (a b : Rbar), Rbar_lt a x -> Rbar_lt x b -> (forall y : R, Rbar_lt a y -> Rbar_lt y b -> P y) -> locally x P
Filter_prod : forall (F : (?T -> Prop) -> Prop) (G : (?U -> Prop) -> Prop) (P : ?T * ?U -> Prop) (Q : ?T -> Prop) (R : ?U -> Prop), F Q -> G R -> (forall (x : ?T) (y : ?U), Q x -> R y -> P (x, y)) -> filter_prod F G P where ?T : [ |- Type] ?U : [ |- Type]
ARmul_assoc : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)
filterlim_mult : forall x y : ?K, filterlim (fun z : ?K * ?K => mult (fst z) (snd z)) (filter_prod (locally x) (locally y)) (locally (mult x y)) where ?K : [ |- AbsRing]
filterlim_plus : forall x y : ?V, filterlim (fun z : ?V * ?V => plus (fst z) (snd z)) (filter_prod (locally x) (locally y)) (locally (plus x y)) where ?K : [ |- AbsRing] ?V : [ |- NormedModule ?K]
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (...
Rmax_case : forall (r1 r2 : R) (P : R -> Type), P r1 -> P r2 -> P (Rmax r1 r2)
ball_triangle : forall (x y z : ?M) (e1 e2 : R), ball x e1 y -> ball y e2 z -> ball x (e1 + e2) z where ?M : [ |- UniformSpace]
Inductive filter_prod (T U : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) (G : (U -> Prop) -> Prop) (P : T * U -> Prop) : Prop := Filter_prod : forall (Q : T -> Prop) (R : U -> Prop), F Q -> G R -> (forall (x : T) (y : U), Q x -> R y -> P (x, y)) -> filter_prod F G P For filter_prod: Arguments T, U are implicit and maximally inserted For Filter_prod: Arguments T, U are implicit and maximally inserted For filter_prod: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope] For Filter_prod: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope _ _ function_scope]
filterlim_scal : forall (k : ?K) (x : ?V), filterlim (fun z : ?K * ?V => scal (fst z) (snd z)) (filter_prod (locally k) (locally x)) (locally (scal k x)) where ?K : [ |- AbsRing] ?V : [ |- NormedModule ?K]
locally_norm = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (x : V) (P : V -> Prop) => exists eps : posreal, forall y : V, ball_norm x eps y -> P y : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), V -> (V -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ _ function_scope]
plus_assoc : forall x y z : ?G, plus x (plus y z) = plus (plus x y) z where ?G : [ |- AbelianGroup]
filter_and : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, ?F P -> ?F Q -> ?F (fun x : ?T => P x /\ Q x) where ?T : [ |- Type] ?F : [ |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [ |- Filter ?F]
ssrbool.iffP : forall (P Q : Prop) (b : bool), Bool.reflect P b -> (P -> Q) -> (Q -> P) -> Bool.reflect Q b
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P Datatypes.nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)%list) -> forall l : list A, P l
Ring_polynom.Pol_ind : forall (C : Type) (P : Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Prop), (forall c : C, P (Ring_polynom.Pc c)) -> (forall (p : positive) (p0 : Ring_polynom.Pol C), P p0 -> P (Ring_polynom.Pinj p p0)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.Pol C, P p -> forall (p0 : positive) (p1 : Ring_polynom.Pol C), P p1 -> P (Ring_polynom.PX p p0 p1)) -> forall p : Ring_polynom.Pol C, P p
morph_eq : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> forall x y : C, ceqb x y = true -> req (phi x) (phi y)
within = fun (T : Type) (D : T -> Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) (P : T -> Prop) => F (fun x : T => D x -> P x) : forall T : Type, (T -> Type) -> ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> (T -> Prop) -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
Ring_polynom.Peq_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> forall (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> forall P P' : Ring_polynom.Pol C, Ring_polynom.Peq ceqb P P' = true -> Ring_polynom.Pequiv rO radd rmul req phi P P'
filter_le = fun (T : Type) (F G : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) => forall P : T -> Prop, G P -> F P : forall T : Type, ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope function_scope]
filtermap = fun (T U : Type) (f : T -> U) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) (P : U -> Prop) => F (fun x : T => P (f x)) : forall T U : Type, (T -> U) -> ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> (U -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments T, U are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
filter_imp : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, P x -> Q x) -> ?F P -> ?F Q where ?T : [ |- Type] ?F : [ |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [ |- Filter ?F]
Ring_polynom.mon_of_pol_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> forall l : list R, req (rmul (phi (fst m)) (Ring_polynom.Mphi rO rI rmul l (snd m))) (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l P)
filterlim_locally : forall (f : ?T -> ?U) (y : ?U), filterlim f ?F (locally y) < -> (forall eps : posreal, ?F (fun x : ?T => ball y eps (f x))) where ?T : [ |- Type] ?U : [ |- UniformSpace] ?F : [ |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [ |- Filter ?F]
open_neq : forall y : R, open (fun u : R => u <> y)
open_lt : forall y : R, open (fun u : R => u < y)
prod_ball = fun (U V : UniformSpace) (x : U * V) (eps : R) (y : U * V) => ball (fst x) eps (fst y) /\ ball (snd x) eps (snd y) : forall U V : UniformSpace, U * V -> R -> U * V -> Prop Arguments U, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ _ R_scope _]
filter_prod_proper = fun (T1 T2 : Type) (F : (T1 -> Prop) -> Prop) (G : (T2 -> Prop) -> Prop) (FF : ProperFilter F) (FG : ProperFilter G) => {| filter_ex := fun (P : T1 * T2 -> Prop) (H : filter_prod F G P) => match H with | @Filter_prod _ _ _ _ _ Q1 Q2 H1 H2 HP => (fun _evar_0_ : forall (x : T1) (p : (fun x0 : T1 => Q1 x0) x), (fun _ : exists x0 : T1, Q1 x0 => exists x0 : T1 * T2, P x0) (ex_intro (fun x0 : T1 => Q1 x0) x p) => match filter_ex Q1 H1 as e return ((fun _ : exists x : T1, Q1 x => exists x : T...
Inductive reflect (P : Prop) : bool -> Set := ReflectT : P -> Bool.reflect P true | ReflectF : ~ P -> Bool.reflect P false For reflect: Argument scopes are [type_scope bool_scope] For ReflectT: Argument scopes are [type_scope _] For ReflectF: Argument scopes are [type_scope _]
Rbar_lt_locally : forall (a b : Rbar) (x : R), Rbar_lt a x -> Rbar_lt x b -> exists delta : posreal, forall y : R, Rabs (y - x) < delta -> Rbar_lt a y /\ Rbar_lt y b
